thread.title: #GiveTwitterASlogan: Funniest Ways People Define the Social Network
thread.title_full: #GiveTwitterASlogan: Funniest Ways People Define the Social Network - ABC News

author: abcNEWS
title: #GiveTwitterASlogan: Funniest Ways People Define the Social Network
text:
How would you describe Twitter to someone who doesn't know what it is? A popular new hashtag #GiveTwitterASlogan picked up steam today -- and people are giving it their best to come up with a slogan for the social network in 140 characters or less. 
The meta hashtag comes as Twitter today announced it would be laying off 336 people -- approximately 8 percent of its work force -- in order to put the company on a "stronger path to grow." Having taken over as CEO earlier this month, co-founder Jack Dorsey faces the challenge of making Twitter more approachable and engaging for new users. 

Jack Dorsey Will Return As Twitter CEO 

Why Twitter Is Laying Off 8 Percent of Its Employees 

7 Things to Know About Jack Dorsey 
If Dorsey checks out the hashtag, here are some of the more entertaining suggestions he'll find: 

Uninformed people shouting about things they don't understand. #GiveTwitterASlogan 
— Calum McSwiggan (@CalumMcSwiggan) October 13, 2015 

Twitter - A place where limited characters excel. #GiveTwitterASlogan 
— Barry Crimmins (@crimmins) October 13, 2015 

#GiveTwitterASlogan : "Facebook is full of people you know and don't like. Twitter is full of people you like and don't know."
— Huma Kayani ? (@HumaKayani_) October 13, 2015 

#GiveTwitterASlogan Talk To Yourself, It's Cheaper Than Therapy.
— Vanessa Ann V (@VanessaVanDS) October 13, 2015 

It's like Facebook, but without your parents. #GiveTwitterASlogan 
— Karan (@Bastianisation) October 13, 2015 

If You Can't Say It In 140 characters, Don't Say It At All. #GiveTwitterASlogan 
— Sir Ravindra Jadeja (@SirJadeja) October 13, 2015 
  " 
#GiveTwitterASlogan: Funniest Ways People Define the Social Network " 
Breaking
